sentence: 운동을 할수록 체력이 좋아져서, 더 오랜 시간동안 운동할 수 있게 됩니다.
translation: As I exercise more, my stamina improves and I am able to exercise for longer periods of time.

sentence: 사람들과 많이 대화할수록, 한국어 실력이 점점 더 향상됩니다.
translation: The more I talk with people, the more my Korean language skills improve.

sentence: 공부할수록, 내 실력을 향상시키고 좀 더 많은 일을 할 수 있게 됩니다.
translation: As I study more, I improve my skills and am able to do more things.

sentence: 자주 운동하지 않을수록, 건강이 나빠지고 체력이 떨어집니다.
translation: The less often I exercise, the worse my health becomes and my stamina decreases.

sentence: 여행을 할수록, 새로운 문화와 사람들을 만나서, 많은 경험을 쌓을 수 있습니다.
translation: The more I travel, the more I can accumulate new experiences by meeting new cultures and people.

sentence: 한국어를 잘 하려면, 열심히 공부해야 합니다.
translation: If you want to speak Korean well, you need to study hard.

sentence: 내일 시험을 잘 보려면, 오늘 밤 늦게까지 공부해야 합니다.
translation: If I want to do well on tomorrow's exam, I need to study late into the night today.

sentence: 사람들과 원활하게 소통하려면, 좋은 언어 실력이 필요합니다.
translation: If you want to communicate well with people, you need good language skills.

sentence: 여행을 다녀오려면, 충분한 예산이 필요합니다.
translation: If you want to go on a trip, you need sufficient budget.

sentence: 이 일을 해결하려면, 창의적인 해결책이 필요합니다.
translation: If we want to solve this problem, we need a creative solution.

sentence: 과자를 사거나 음료수를 사세요.
translation: Buy either snacks or drinks.

sentence: 기차로 갈 거나 버스로 갈 거나, 어떻게 갈지 고민 중이다.
translation: I'm trying to decide whether to go by train or by bus.

sentence: 여행을 가거나 집에서 쉴 거나, 어떻게 할지 결정 중이다.
translation: I'm trying to decide whether to go on a trip or to stay at home and rest.

sentence: 스케이트를 타거나 스노우보드를 타거나, 어떤 것이 좋을까?
translation: Should I go skating or snowboarding? Which one is better?

sentence: 책을 읽거나 쓰거나, 시간을 낭비하지 마세요.
translation: Don't waste your time, read a book or write something.

sentence: 나는 늦은 거든 너도 늦은 거든 같이 가자.
translation: Let's go together whether I'm late or you're late.

sentence: 저녁을 먹은 거든 안 먹은 거든, 이야기나 나누러 갈까?
translation: Shall we go talk, whether you've had dinner or not?

sentence: 비가 오는 거든 맑은 날이 거든, 매일 조깅을 합니다.
translation: I go jogging every day, whether it's raining or it's a sunny day.

sentence: 바쁜 거든 한가한 거든, 운동은 꾸준히 합니다.
translation: I exercise regularly, whether I'm busy or free.

sentence: 시험에 합격한 거든 불합격한 거든, 열심히 공부해야 합니다.
translation: Whether you pass or fail the exam, you need to study hard.

sentence: 밥을 먹고 나서, 영화를 보러 갔어요.
translation: After eating, we went to watch a movie.

sentence: 책을 읽고 나서, 잠을 자기 시작했어요.
translation: After reading a book, I started to sleep.

sentence: 운동을 하고 나서, 샤워를 해야 돼요.
translation: After exercising, you should take a shower.

sentence: 물을 마시고 나서, 이메일을 확인했어요.
translation: After drinking water, I checked my email.

sentence: 폰을 꺼놓고 나서, 산책을 갔어요.
translation: After turning off my phone, I went for a walk.

sentence: 일하느라고 점심을 먹지 못했어요.
translation: I couldn't have lunch because I was working.

sentence: 공부하느라고 친구들과 놀지 못했어요.
translation: I couldn't hang out with my friends because I was studying.

sentence: 자기 전까지 일을 하느라고 피곤해 죽겠어요.
translation: I'm dead tired because I worked until before going to bed.

sentence: 우산을 가져오느라고 지갑을 놓고 왔어요.
translation: I forgot my wallet because I was bringing an umbrella.

sentence: 여행을 준비하느라고 바빴어요.
translation: I was busy preparing for the trip.

sentence: 학교에 가는 길에 친구를 만났어요.
translation: I met a friend on the way to school.

sentence: 집에 돌아오는 길에 비가 오기 시작했어요.
translation: It started to rain on the way back home.

sentence: 시장에서 장을 보고 있는 길에 아이스크림을 먹었어요.
translation: I ate ice cream on the way back from the market.

sentence: 산책하는 길에 예쁜 꽃을 보았어요.
translation: I saw pretty flowers on the way while taking a walk.

sentence: 여행 중인 길에 갑자기 비행기가 불안정하게 날았어요.
translation: The airplane suddenly flew unsteadily on the way during the trip.

sentence: 남들이 하는 대로 하면 안 돼요.
translation: You shouldn't just do what others do.

sentence: 일하는 대로 돈을 벌 수 있는 건 아니에요.
translation: You can't make money just by working.

sentence: 가장 좋아하는 대로 하세요.
translation: Do what you like the most.

sentence: 꿈을 향해 열심히 노력하는 대로 성공할 수 있어요.
translation: You can succeed as much as you work hard towards your dream.

sentence: 삶에서 행복한 대로 살아가면 되요.
translation: Just live as happy as you can in life.

sentence: 돈은 없지만 건강한 대신에 행복합니다.
translation: I'm happy despite having no money, but being healthy.

sentence: 과제는 내가 대신해 줄게요.
translation: I'll do the assignment in your place.

sentence: 시간이 없는 대신에 돈을 써서 해결했어요.
translation: I solved the problem by spending money instead of time.

sentence: 저는 휴가를 포기하고 대신에 일을 했어요.
translation: I gave up my vacation and worked instead.

sentence: 그 일을 할 수 없는 대신에 다른 일을 할게요.
translation: I'll do another job instead of not being able to do that one.

sentence: 시간을 충분히 주다 보면 문제를 해결할 수 있을 거예요.
translation: If you give enough time, you can solve the problem.

sentence: 미래를 생각하다 보면 불안해지는 경우가 많아요.
translation: When you think about the future, you often become anxious.

sentence: 그는 처음에는 어색했지만, 친해짐에 따라 다 보면 좋은 친구가 되었어요.
translation: He was awkward at first, but as we got closer, he became a good friend.

sentence: 여행을 하다 보면 좋은 추억이 많아져요.
translation: As you travel more, you will have more good memories.

sentence: 노력하다 보면 결국 성공할 수 있어요.
translation: If you keep working hard, you will eventually succeed.

sentence: 날씨가 좋았더니 갑자기 비가 오기 시작했어요.
translation: The weather was nice, but suddenly it started raining.

sentence: 그는 도망쳤더니 결국 경찰에 붙잡혔어요.
translation: He ran away, but was eventually caught by the police.

sentence: 연락이 안 되더니 전화기가 고장났던 거예요.
translation: I couldn't get in touch, but it turned out my phone was broken.

sentence: 영어는 잘하는 줄 알았더니, 회사에서는 제대로 말을 못 하네요.
translation: I thought I was good at English, but I can't speak it properly at work.

sentence: 프로그램이 오래 걸리더니, 점심을 먹으러 나갔다가 돌아와도 계속 실행 중이었어요.
translation: The program took a long time, so I went out to have lunch and when I came back, it was still running.

sentence: 비가 오더라도 축제는 계속 진행될 예정입니다.
translation: The festival will continue even if it rains.

sentence: 일찍 일어나더라도 버스를 놓치지 않도록 조심하세요.
translation: Even if you wake up early, be careful not to miss the bus.

sentence: 돈이 많아야 행복하다는 건 늙은 사람들이 믿는 이야기더라도, 사실은 그렇지 않아요.
translation: Even though old people believe that having a lot of money brings happiness, it's not true.

sentence: 시간이 부족하더라도 프로젝트를 완료해야 합니다.
translation: Even if we don't have enough time, we have to complete the project.

sentence: 어떤 일이 있더라도 친구를 돕는 것은 당연한 일입니다.
translation: It's natural to help a friend, even if something else is happening.

sentence: 시험이 어려우니까 열심히 공부하도록 해요.
translation: Since the exam is difficult, let's study hard for it.

sentence: 반드시 계약서를 읽고 서명하도록 하세요.
translation: Make sure to read and sign the contract.

sentence: 내년에 해외여행을 가려면 이번에 돈을 모아둬야 돼요.
translation: If you want to travel abroad next year, you need to save money now.

sentence: 한국어를 잘하도록 노력하고 있습니다.
translation: I'm trying to become good at Korean.

sentence: 부모님께 효도하도록 노력해야 합니다.
translation: We should make an effort to be filial to our parents.

sentence: 오늘 밤에 뭐를 먹든지 결정하면 알려주세요.
translation: Let me know what you want to eat tonight.

sentence: 토론을 하든지, 자유로운 토론 시간을 가지세요.
translation: Have a free discussion time, or have a debate.

sentence: 시간 내에 일을 마치든지, 내일 다시 오세요.
translation: Finish your work on time, or come back tomorrow.

sentence: 어디를 가든지, 그곳에서 즐거운 시간을 보내세요.
translation: Wherever you go, have a good time there.

sentence: 부모님께서 오시든지, 저희는 반갑게 맞이하겠습니다.
translation: Whether my parents come or not, we will welcome them warmly.

sentence: 그녀는 감기에 걸린 것처럼 코를 계속 풀고 있어요.
translation: She keeps blowing her nose as if she caught a cold.

sentence: 어제 밤에는 외로웠던 것처럼 그녀가 연락해왔어요.
translation: She contacted me as if she was lonely last night.

sentence: 그녀는 눈물을 흘리는 것처럼 매우 슬퍼 보였어요.
translation: She looked very sad as if she was shedding tears.

sentence: 그가 남자친구처럼 나를 대할 때마다 좋았어요.
translation: I liked it whenever he treated me like his boyfriend.

sentence: 나는 그가 날 지켜주는 것처럼 안심했다.
translation: I felt relieved as if he was protecting me.

sentence: 비록 시간이 부족해도 노력해 보세요.
translation: Even if you're short on time, try your best.

sentence: 그녀와 얘기를 하기가 어려워도 대화를 시작해 보세요.
translation: Even if it's difficult to talk to her, try starting a conversation.

sentence: 이것이 실수라도 용서해 주세요.
translation: Please forgive me even if it's a mistake.

sentence: 너무 바쁘다고 해서 운동하지 않아도 돼요.
translation: Even if you're too busy, you don't have to exercise.

sentence: 힘들어도 포기하지 마세요.
translation: Don't give up even if it's difficult.

sentence: 시간을 더 있었다면, 더 많은 일을 할 수 있었을 텐데.
translation: If I had more time, I could have done more things.

sentence: 지하철을 놓쳤더라면 더 늦어졌을 거야.
translation: If I had missed the subway, I would have been even later.

sentence: 집에 머물렀더라면, 이 일을 당하지 않았을 텐데.
translation: If I had stayed home, I wouldn't have had this problem.

sentence: 오늘은 비가 오지 않았더라면, 나들이를 갔을텐데.
translation: If it didn't rain today, we would have gone out.

sentence: 그 사람을 더 잘 알고 있었다면, 더 효율적인 방법을 썼을 것 같아.
translation: If I knew him better, I think I could have used a more efficient way.

sentence: 이번 시험에서 잘 봤으나 마나 다음 시험에서 또 잘 볼 수 있으면 좋겠어.
translation: Whether I did well on this test or not, I hope I can do well on the next one too.

sentence: 희망은 있으나 마나 현실은 더 중요해.
translation: Although there is hope, reality is more important.

sentence: 이 책은 가볍으나 마나 깊은 의미를 담고 있어.
translation: Although this book is light, it contains deep meanings.

sentence: 내가 얼마나 바쁘던 유무나 마나 그 일을 끝내야 했어.
translation: Whether I was busy or not, I had to finish that task.

sentence: 아이들은 어리/거나 마나 잘 즐겼어.
translation: Whether they were young or not, the kids had a good time.

sentence: 그녀가 일찍 집에 가는 걸 봤는데, 늦게까지 일했을까 봐 걱정이 돼.
translation: I saw her leave early, and I'm worried she worked late.

sentence: 바쁘다고 했는데, 건강이 안 좋은 건 아닐까 봐 걱정이 돼.
translation: They said they were busy, but I'm worried their health might not be good.

sentence: 그 도시는 위험한 곳이라서, 딸이 거기서 일을 하지 않았으면 좋겠어. 걱정이 돼 까 봐.
translation: That city is a dangerous place, so I hope my daughter doesn't work there. I'm worried about it.

sentence: 항상 너무 늦게 자서 건강이 좋지 않을까 봐 걱정돼.
translation: I'm worried that they don't get enough sleep and their health might not be good.

sentence: 지갑을 잃어버렸을까 봐 지갑 안에 있는 카드를 전부 막았어.
translation: I cancelled all my cards in my wallet because I'm worried that I might have lost it.

sentence: 출발하자마자 비가 내렸다.
translation: It started raining right after we left.

sentence: 저녁 식사를 먹자마자 친구들과 함께 술을 마셨다.
translation: After having dinner, I drank with my friends.

sentence: 시험이 끝나자마자 바로 친구들과 놀러 갔다.
translation: As soon as the exam finished, I went out to play with my friends.

sentence: 이메일을 보내자마자 바로 답장이 왔다.
translation: I received a reply immediately after sending the email.

sentence: 방문하자마자 깨끗하게 청소를 해 놓았다.
translation: They cleaned the room thoroughly as soon as they arrived.
